QuickTips.1: Canned responses are pre-made messages you can recall easily during chat.
QuickTips.1B: To use it type “/” (forward slash) and follow it with a word or the first few letters of any word that is included in the canned response title.
QuickTips.1C: From the returned list of saved responses select the response you want to use.
QuickTips.2: If you often reply to the same customer questions, consider saving those replies as canned responses.
QuickTips.3: With canned responses, you type it once, save it and reuse it in chats whenever you need.
QuickTips.4: You can also create a more engaging experience for your customers by using personalization in your message:
QuickTips.5: 1) When editing a message, you can insert a personalization field by first selecting the area in which you'd like to create the field.
QuickTips.6: 2) Next, click the ADD PERSONALIZATION button
QuickTips.7: 3) Clicking the ADD PERSONALIZATION button will provide a list where you can select which personalization value you would like to add to your message.

HoursPage.GeneralOperatingHoursDescription: Conversations will be assigned to agents based on their availability status evaluated in the range of opening hours. The “General” operating hours refers to your whole project. Your customers/users cannot ask for an agent during “offline hours” and their requests will be automatically put in the “Unassigned conversations” queue. You can also use opening hours in an automation though the “If operating hours” action.
HoursPage.TimeSlotDescription: An “Operating Hours Slot” defines a range of hours that can be used in an automation to move to the next block based on a match between the current time and the defined slot hours.

TheDefaulDeptIsDisabledBecause: The Default Routing is disabled because at least one other department exists and its status is set to 'Visible'
TheDefaulDeptIsDisabledBecause_2: The Default Department is disabled because at least one other department exists and its status is set to 'Visible'
TheDefaulDeptIsEnabledBecause: The Default Routing is enabled because no other department is 'Visible'
TheDefaulDeptIsEnabledBecause_2: The Default Department and its routing rules are enabled because no other department is 'Visible'
ThisStepOfTheWizardGuidesYouThroughTheBa: This step of the wizard guides you through the basic setup. You can change the widget style, default language and more at any time via the widget settings
DeptQuickTips_1: Departments are the various business divisions within your organization.
DeptQuickTips_2: Each department can have its own agents, chatbot and routing rules; this allows you to customize a support process independent of your other departments.
DeptQuickTips_3: The Default Department is created immediately after you create the project.
DeptQuickTips_4: This department cannot be deleted but can always be modified.
DeptQuickTips_5: The Default Department will be automatically disabled if there is at least one other department whose visibility status is set to visible
DeptQuickTips_6: If exists only the Default Department or if there are other departments but with visibility status set to 'Not Visible', the visitors' requests will be routed according to the rules of the Default Department.
DeptQuickTips_7: If there are more than one department but only one has the visibility status set to 'Visible', visitor's requests will be implicitly routed according to the rules of this department (it is still possible to route requests via API to 'Not Visible' departments)
DeptQuickTips_8: If at least two departments have the visibility status set to 'Visible', visitors will be able to choose which department to route requests to through the appropriate widget selection menu.

WidgetInstallations.Title: Show live chat to your visitors
WidgetInstallations.Subtitle: Allow your visitors to contact you via live chat, by adding our widget to your website.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStep1: Log in to the Wordpress control panel.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStep3: Under “Theme files” (far right), find the theme footer (footer.php) and select it.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStep4: Copy and paste the following script before the tag
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStep5: and click on “Update file” to save the changes.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA1: Log in to your WordPress account and go to Dashboard
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA2: Go to the “Plugins” section and select “Add New”.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA3: Type “Tiledesk” in the search bar and hit the “Install Now” button. Once installed, be sure to press the “Activate” button before proceeding.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA4: Click on “Tiledesk Chat” in the left menu of WordPress.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA5: Enter your email and password and press the “Login” button to access “Tiledesk”.
WidgetInstallations.WordpressStepA6: Select the project you want to integrate into your website and press the “Select” button.
WidgetInstallations.ShopifyStep2: Log in to the Shopify panel.
WidgetInstallations.ShopifyStep3: Go to “Online Store > Themes > Actions“, in the current theme, from the drop-down menu select “Actions > Change code“.
WidgetInstallations.ShopifyStep4: In the Layout folder, select the theme.liquid file and paste the JavaScript code you copied in step one, just before the tag
WidgetInstallations.PrestashopStep2: Log in to the Prestashop control panel.
WidgetInstallations.PrestashopStep6: Go to “Modules > Modules Management”, click on “Upload a module”, then click on ”select a file” and select the HTMLbox module downloaded in the previous point.
WidgetInstallations.PrestashopStep7: At the end of the installation of the module, click on “configure“, in the text area select “Tools > Source code“ and paste the JavaScript code copied in point one.
WidgetInstallations.JoomlaStep2: Log in to the Joomla control panel.
WidgetInstallations.JoomlaStep3: Go to “System > Templates > Site Templates“ and click on the default theme template.
WidgetInstallations.JoomlaStep4: Open the index.php file from the menu on the left side and paste in the editor the JavaScript code you copied in step one, before the closing tag
WidgetInstallations.MagentoStep2: Go to your Magento admin page, then Content > Design > Configuration
WidgetInstallations.MagentoStep3: Expand the HTML Head section and paste the JavaScript code copied in point one into the Scripts and Style Sheets field, and then press the “Save configuration” button
WidgetInstallations.MagentoStep4: Go to System > Cache management, select ALL checkboxes, and press the Refresh/Submit button
WidgetInstallations.MagentoStep5: Once you save the settings open your website. Your Widget should appear in the bottom right corner.
WidgetInstallations.Wix2: Go to your Wix website's dashboard, then Settings > Advanced > "Custom Code" tab.
WidgetInstallations.Wix3: Click on the "+ Add Custom Code" button and, in the text box provided, paste the JavaScript code copied in point one
WidgetInstallations.Wix4: Give your code snippet a recognizable name. This will make it easier to identify later.
WidgetInstallations.Wix5: Choose where you want the code to be applied:
WidgetInstallations.Wix5A: "All pages": This adds the widget to all of your site's pages, including future pages.
WidgetInstallations.Wix5B: "Choose specific pages": Use the drop-down menu to select the specific pages where you want to display the widget.
WidgetInstallations.Wix6: Select where you want to place the code within your page's HTML structure. Options include:
WidgetInstallations.Wix7: Finally, click the "Apply" button to save your changes and activate widget on your Wix website.
WidgetInstallations.Bc1: Log in to your BigCommerce account. From the left navigation, click "Storefront".
WidgetInstallations.Bc2: Click "Script Manager", and click "Create a Script".
WidgetInstallations.Bc3: Name your script, give it a Description (optional), select "Footer" for the placement and "Functional" in "Script category".
WidgetInstallations.Bc4: Check "Script" in the section "Script type", and then paste the JavaScript code you copied in step one into the "Script contents" box. Click "Save".

NoteThatTheWidgetLabelsOnAwebsite: Note that the widget phrases on a website (and on the live test page) will be displayed in the browser language if the same is present among the languages of the Multilinguage page, otherwise they will be displayed in the language that has been set as the default language.

This option disables the possibility of viewing the home with the list of open conversations and those already archived. This change makes conversations more of a continuous thread, preventing customers from reaching out to your team multiple times, which saves your team time and effort.
